BEIRUT - The death toll in Syria 's three - year conflict has climbed past 160,000 , an activist group said Monday , a harrowing figure that reflects the relentless bloodletting in a civil war that appears no closer to being resolved .
The grim tally , however , only presents one facet of the tremendous suffering that Syrians have endured since the revolt against President Bashar Assad erupted in March 2011 .

The crisis has also uprooted some 6.5 million people from their homes , forced 2.7 million to flee the country , laid waste to cities and towns alike , and unleashed sectarian hatreds that have rippled across the region .
